title: Guess Who Game
description: Packed with JavaScript that highlights the conditional statements to make the game work.

title: Weather App
description: A weather app done in pairs that used API to fetch the data and display weather depending on where the user is.

title: Music Releases
description: New music app done in pair. Fetched data from Spotify API.

title: Stockholm Tour
description: A website created in mob programming session that contains forms and JavaScript for people who wants to sign up for an event.

title: New Movies
description: A multipage site that shows the current most popular movies and a details page about the selected movie when clicked.

title: Quiz with Redux
description: A group project to create a quiz with main focus on learning how to use Redux.

title: A News Site for Plants Lovers
description: A first simple site that focused on the execution of grid, flexbox and responsiveness in many devices.

title: Labyrinth
description: A project done in pairs to create a text based game Labyrinth to practice how APIs work together with Redux.

title: Backend Project - Express API
description: The basic of backend. Main focus is building my own API. Then I created several routes and endpoints that return single result or array of elements.

title: Backend Project - Mongo API
description: A project focuses on how to use MongoDB to store data and how to query that data from your API. I retrieved data from Kaggle and convert it to JSON file.

title: Backend + Frontend Project - Happy Thoughts
description: Another backend project where I learnt about allowing user to POST data to my API and then use that data to save new objects in my Mongo database.Then The backend project is connected to the frontend project from previous weeks

title: Backend + Frontend Project - Authentication API
description: This project's goal was developing an API with authentication in order to implement a login/register interface with authentication. We learned how to authenticate users using tokens and how to store passwords in databases in a secure way. We also created a Frontend with a form to register, login and be able to see restricted content in case the login was successful.

title: Side project - Webpage for A Mechanic
description: A side project that is planned, designed and executed by myself. The project is ongoing, therefore it is not ready to be deployed. It's made with React and React router dom to navigate between pages
